Mexican Street Corn Salad

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to your new favorite summer side dish: Mexican Street Corn Salad! This vibrant and flavorful salad brings the essence of traditional Mexican street corn, or elote, right to your dining table. Bursting with the sweetness of fresh corn, tangy lime juice, and the creamy richness of feta cheese, this dish is perfect for barbecues, picnics, or simply as a refreshing accompaniment to any meal. Whether you use fresh or frozen corn, this salad is quick and easy to whip up, making it a go-to recipe for busy weeknights or festive gatherings. Packed with fresh ingredients like red onion and cilantro, and seasoned with chili powder, this salad not only promises a delightful crunch but also an explosion of flavors in every bite. Join me as we dive into this delicious recipe that is sure to impress your family and friends!

Ingredients

sweet corn (fresh or frozen)

If using fresh corn, opt for sweet, in-season corn for the best flavor. Grill or boil it with the husks on for added moisture and smokiness. If using frozen corn, choose high-quality brands without added sugars or preservatives, and cook until just tender to maintain a sweet flavor.

feta cheese, crumbled

Feta adds a tangy flavor and creamy texture to the salad. If you want a milder taste, try using goat cheese or cotija cheese as a substitute. For a dairy-free option, use a crumbled tofu seasoned with lemon juice and salt.

red onion, finely chopped

To reduce the sharpness of raw red onion, soak the chopped onion in cold water for 10-15 minutes, then drain before adding to the salad. Alternatively, use green onions or shallots for a milder flavor.

cilantro, chopped

For a fresh, vibrant flavor, use fresh cilantro only. If you're not a fan of cilantro, parsley can be a suitable substitute, though it will change the flavor profile. Add the cilantro at the end to maintain its freshness.

lime juice

Freshly squeezed lime juice is much more flavorful than bottled. If lime isn’t available, lemon juice can be used as a substitute, although it will impart a different flavor. To enhance the citrus flavor, consider adding lime zest as well.

olive oil

Use extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor in your dressing. If you're looking for a lighter option, you could substitute with avocado oil, which has a similar consistency and flavor profile.

chili powder

Chili powder can vary in heat and flavor; taste your chili powder first. For a spicier kick, consider using cayenne pepper or a chipotle chili powder. If you prefer a milder flavor, you can substitute it with smoked paprika.

salt

Always taste before adding salt, as feta cheese is already salty. If you prefer a lower sodium option, consider using a salt substitute or simply reduce the amount used in the dressing.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper adds a great depth of flavor. For added complexity, consider using white pepper or even a pinch of red pepper flakes for a slight heat.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Corn

    If using fresh corn, grill or boil the corn until tender, about 5-7 minutes. For frozen corn, cook according to package instructions until heated through and then drain.

  • Step 2: Combine Main Ingredients

    In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked corn, crumbled feta cheese, finely chopped red onion, and chopped cilantro.

  • Step 3: Make the Dressing

    In a separate small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, chili powder, salt, and pepper until well blended.

  • Step 4: Mix Salad and Dressing

    Pour the dressing over the corn mixture. Toss gently to combine, ensuring that all ingredients are evenly coated.

  • Step 5: Serve or Chill

    You can serve the salad immediately for a fresh taste, or refrigerate for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare fresh corn for this salad?

To prepare fresh corn, you can either grill or boil it. If boiling, cook the corn in salted water for about 5-7 minutes until tender. If grilling, place the corn on a preheated grill for about the same time, turning occasionally until cooked. Once done, let it cool slightly before cutting the kernels off the cob.

Can I use canned corn instead of fresh or frozen?

Yes, you can use canned corn! Just drain and rinse it before adding to the salad. This is a quick and easy alternative.

What can I substitute for feta cheese?

If you want a different flavor or need a dairy-free option, try using crumbled goat cheese, queso fresco, or even a dairy-free cheese alternative.

How do I chop red onion finely?

To chop red onion finely, start by cutting off the ends and peeling the skin. Cut the onion in half from top to bottom, then slice thinly from root to tip on each half. Finally, chop across those slices to create small pieces.

Is there a way to make this salad ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the salad up to the point of mixing in the dressing. Store the corn mixture in the fridge and add the dressing just before serving to keep everything fresh.

How can I add more flavor to the salad?

You can add more flavor by incorporating diced jalapeños for heat, adding avocado for creaminess, or including more herbs like parsley or green onions.

What if I don't have lime juice?

If you don’t have lime juice, you can substitute with lemon juice or vinegar (like apple cider or red wine vinegar) for a similar tangy flavor.

How do I know when the corn is cooked properly?

Corn is cooked properly when it's tender and bright yellow. You can test it by piercing a kernel with a fork; it should be firm but easily break apart.

Can I serve this salad warm?

Yes, you can serve it warm, but the flavors are often better when allowed to chill for about 30 minutes in the fridge.

What should I do if I accidentally over-salt the salad?

If you find the salad is too salty, you can add more corn or other ingredients like diced tomatoes or avocado to help balance the flavors.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This salad can easily be made gluten-free and vegetarian. For a vegan alternative, substitute the feta cheese with a plant-based cheese or nutritional yeast to maintain a cheesy flavor without dairy. If you're looking for a lower-carb option, consider replacing sweet corn with a blend of grilled zucchini and bell peppers, while still keeping the other ingredients for flavor. Adjust the chili powder to suit spice levels according to dietary preferences.

Pairings

For an excellent pairing with Mexican Street Corn Salad, consider serving it alongside grilled meats such as chicken, steak, or shrimp that have been seasoned with cumin and lime. A refreshing beverage like a light lager beer, margarita, or non-alcoholic agua fresca with fruit can enhance the meal. Additionally, for a vegetarian option, pair with black bean tacos or grilled vegetable skewers.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the salad in a colorful bowl to highlight its vibrant ingredients. Garnish with extra cilantro and lime wedges for added freshness. For a more festive presentation, serve alongside a platter of tortilla chips for scooping, or use it as a topping for grilled corn on the cob, allowing guests to enjoy a hands-on experience. If serving at a gathering, consider offering it as part of a taco bar where guests can create their own tacos with the salad as a flavorful topping.

#

Mexican Street Corn Salad

20 min
$10
200 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

Dairy

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianGluten-Free

Cuisine:

Mexican

Course:

SaladSide Dish

Tags:

SaladEasyMexicanVegetarian

Description

A fresh, flavorful salad with the essence of street corn, combining sweet corn, tangy lime, creamy feta, and vibrant cilantro!

Ingredients

  • sweet corn (fresh or frozen): 4 cups
  • feta cheese, crumbled: 1 cup
  • red onion, finely chopped: 1/2 cup
  • cilantro, chopped: 1/4 cup
  • lime juice: 3 tablespoons
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • chili powder: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/17/2024
